info.title: Conversations Inbox & Messages
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: If you're using the conversations inbox in HubSpot, but you want to report on support agent productivity in an external tool or export message data to an external service, you can build an integration with the conversations and messages API.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the conversations API to manage and send messages via the connected channels in your conversations inbox. You can retrieve existing messages, update threads, and provide internal comments for agents on your team.

get.description: Retrieve a list of conversations inboxes, with optional filters and sorting.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

next.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response

type.description: Specifies whether this refers to a Conversations Inbox or to the Help Desk. Valid values are INBOX or HELP_DESK

get.description: Retrieve a single thread by its ID

associatedContactId.description: The ID of the associated Contact in the CRM. If the Contact for the thread has not yet been added or created, the `associatedContactId` returned will be a visitorID and cannot be used to search for the Contact in the CRM.

latestMessageTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent or received on the thread.

latestMessageSentTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent on the thread.

id.description: The unique ID of the thread.

closedAt.description: When the thread was closed. Only set if the thread is closed.

spam.description: Whether the thread is marked as spam.

inboxId.description: The ID of the conversations inbox containing the thread.

latestMessageReceivedTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent on the thread.

delete.description: Archives a single thread. The thread will be permanently deleted 30 days after placed in an archived state.

patch.description: Updates a single thread. Either a thread's status can be updated, or the thread can be restored.

archived.description: Whether this thread is archived. Set to false to restore the thread.

associatedContactId.description: The ID of the associated Contact in the CRM. If the Contact for the thread has not yet been added or created, the `associatedContactId` returned will be a visitorID and cannot be used to search for the Contact in the CRM.

latestMessageTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent or received on the thread.

latestMessageSentTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent on the thread.

id.description: The unique ID of the thread.

closedAt.description: When the thread was closed. Only set if the thread is closed.

spam.description: Whether the thread is marked as spam.

inboxId.description: The ID of the conversations inbox containing the thread.

latestMessageReceivedTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent on the thread.

get.summary: Get the original content of a single message
get.description: Returns the complete original text and rich text bodies of a message. This will be different from the text and rich text in the message itself if the message's `truncationStatus` is anything other than `NOT_TRUNCATED`.
Retrieve a list of channels, with optional filters and sorting.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

next.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response

get.description: Retrieve details of a single actor using the actor ID.
Retrieve a list of threads, with optional filters and sorting.

latestMessageSentTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent on the thread.

id.description: The unique ID of the thread.

closedAt.description: When the thread was closed. Only set if the thread is closed.

spam.description: Whether the thread is marked as spam.

inboxId.description: The ID of the conversations inbox containing the thread.

latestMessageReceivedTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent on the thread.

get.summary: Get message history for a thread
get.description: Retrieve the message history for a specific thread.

integrationAppId.description: The ID of the client if the client is an integration.

type.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

value.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

post.description: Resolve a set of `ActorId`s to the underlying actors/participants.

subCategory.description: A more specific error category within each main category.

context.description: Additional context-specific information related to the error.

links.description: URLs linking to documentation or resources associated with the error.

id.description: A unique ID for the error instance.

category.description: The main category of the error.

message.description: A human-readable string describing the error and possible remediation steps.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

get.description: Retrieve the details about a custom channel. This API allows you to see a custom channel's current capabilties and other configuration metadata

delete.description: Archive an existing registered custom channel

patch.description: Update the capabilities for an existing. You can also use it to update the channel's webhookUri and its channelAccountConnectionRedirectUrl.

patch.description: Update a message's status to indicate if it was successfully sent, failed to send, or was read. For failed messages, this can also include the error message for the failure.

statusType.description: Valid status are SENT, FAILED, and READ

patch.summary: Update a channel account staging token
patch.description: Update a channel account staging token's account name and delivery identifier. This information will be applied to the channel account created from this staging token. This is used for public apps.

value.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

get.summary: Get a channel account by id
get.description: Retrieve the details for a specific channel account. This contains all the metadata about your channel account, including its channel, associated inbox id, and delivery identifier information.

type.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

value.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

patch.description: This API is used to update the name of the channel account and it's isAuthorized status. Setting to isAuthorized flag to False disables the channel account.

type.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

value.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

get.description: Retrieve all custom channels associated with the app.

type.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

name.description: The name of the channel account.

active.description: Whether the channel account is turned on.

id.description: The ID of the channel account.

inboxId.description: The ID of the conversations inbox that contains the channel account.

channelId.description: The ID of the channel that the channel account is an instance of.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

type.description: Specifies whether this refers to a Conversations Inbox or to the Help Desk. Valid values are INBOX or HELP_DESK

archived.description: Whether this thread is archived. Set to false to restore the thread.

subCategory.description: A more specific error category within each main category.

context.description: Additional context-specific information related to the error.

links.description: URLs linking to documentation or resources associated with the error.

id.description: A unique ID for the error instance.

category.description: The main category of the error.

message.description: A human-readable string describing the error and possible remediation steps.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

type.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

value.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

integrationAppId.description: The ID of the client if the client is an integration.

associatedContactId.description: The ID of the associated Contact in the CRM. If the Contact for the thread has not yet been added or created, the `associatedContactId` returned will be a visitorID and cannot be used to search for the Contact in the CRM.

latestMessageTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent or received on the thread.

latestMessageSentTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent on the thread.

id.description: The unique ID of the thread.

closedAt.description: When the thread was closed. Only set if the thread is closed.

spam.description: Whether the thread is marked as spam.

inboxId.description: The ID of the conversations inbox containing the thread.

latestMessageReceivedTimestamp.description: The time that the latest message was sent on the thread.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

NextPage.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response

statusType.description: Valid status are SENT, FAILED, and READ

scopes.conversations.custom_channels.read: Read messages and manage Channel Accounts for an included Custom Channel.
scopes.conversations.custom_channels.write: Publish messages into HubSpot and manage Channel Accounts for an included Custom Channel.
